speaker: child
sentence:
CHI: 然后我就自己再去搬别的椅子来坐.
EXP: 嗯哼.
CHI: <然后>[/]然后爸妈就认为我的行为很好.
EXP: 嗯.
subject: NP
translation:
child: then i got another chair to sit.
experimenter: yeah.
child: then..then (my) mom and dad think my behavior was very good.
experimenter: yeah.

speaker: mother
sentence:
MOT: "那我需要吃药吗?
CHI: "要.
MOT: "姐姐认为是要吃什么药啊?
CHI: "吃这个.
subject: NP
translation:
mother: then do i need to take medicine?
child: (you) need.
mother: which medicine does sister think (i) need to take?
child: take this one

speaker: mother
sentence:
MOT: 他好生气啊.
MOT: 对不对?
MOT: 他认为是那个小姊姊害他的啊.
MOT: 所以他就叫小朋友把小姊姊射下来.
subject: third_person
translation:
mother: he’s very angry.
mother: right?
mother: he thought that it was that little girl who tried to harm him.
mother: so he let the child to shoot the girl down.

speaker: investigator
sentence:
MOT: 哎那如果你们刚好找到的那个小孩都不讲话.
MOT: 怎么办?
EXA: 没有啊.
EXA: 通常是说如果家长不是认为他不会讲话.
EXA: 只是说通常生人的话.
EXA: 那可能多去几次的话,那就会比较好.
subject: NP
translation:
mother: then, if the kid you found never speaks.
mother: what do you do?
investigator: usually, if the parents don’t think he can’t speak
investigator: (if) only to strangers
investigator: then (if) visit a few times, then it would be better.

speaker: mother
sentence:
MOT: 那我觉得这边好像还差个小鸟什么的.
MOT: 你认为呢?
CHI: 我认为画一个啄木鸟好.
MOT: 那就画个啄木鸟吧.
subject: second_person
translation:
mother: then i think this side is missing a small bird or something.
mother: what do you think?
child: i think it’s good to draw a woodpecker/i think we should draw a woodpecker.
mother: then draw a woodpecker.

speaker: child
sentence:

MOT: 你认为呢?
CHI: 我认为画一个啄木鸟好.
MOT: 那就画个啄木鸟吧.

mother: then i think this side is missing a small bird or something.
mother: what do you think?
child: i think it’s good to draw a woodpecker/i think we should draw a woodpecker.
mother: then draw a woodpecker.

speaker: mother
sentence:
MOT: 它们不知道小星星需要什么对吧?
MOT: 它们把它们认为小星星需要的东西都强加到小星星的身上.
MOT: 所以小星星一直是哼哼唧唧的哭.
subject: third_person
translation:
mother: they don’t know what little star needs, right?
mother: they impose all the things they thought little star needs onto little star.
mother: so little star crying and whimpering all the time.

speaker: mother
sentence:
MOT: 打开吧.
MOT: 吆这里有什么东西啊?
MOT: 你看看这是什么东西啊?
MOT: 你认为是什么东西?
MOT: 吆这可以拼成各种各样的图.
subject: second_person
translation:
mother: open it.
mother: wow what’s inside?
mother: take a look, what is this?
mother: what do you think this is?
mother: wow this can be put together into all kinds of pictures.

speaker: mother
sentence:
MOT: 小乌龟说不能这么软.
MOT: 它认为软的东西容易破.
MOT: 是吧?
subject: third_person
translation:
mother: little tutle said (it) cannot be this soft.
mother: it thinks soft things are easily broken.
mother: right?

speaker: mother
sentence:
MOT: 狐狸认为小雪人这样子<不多>[/]不多,才只有一个鼻子.
MOT: 你看它给小雪人又加了个眼睛.
MOT: 你说哪个多哪个少啊?
subject: NP
translation:
mother: fox thinks the little snowman like this is not enough (or this kind of snowman is unusual)–it only has one nose.
mother: you see it (the fox) added eyes to the little snowman.
mother: which one do you think/tell me which one has more and which one has less?

speaker: teacher
sentence:
TEA: 我认为我想把锅就放在这儿.
TEA: 这个锅也放这.
TEA: 这个锅也放在这个下面.
subject: first_person
translation:
teacher: i feel like i think i want to just put the pot here.
teacher: put this pot here too./leave this pot here as well.
teacher: leave this pot underneather here as well.
